verses.verse: Yahweh<WH3068> said<WH559> to Moses,<WH4872> "Go<WH935> in to Pharaoh,<WH6547> for I have hardened<WH3513> his heart,<WH3820> and the heart<WH3820> of his servants,<WH5650> that I may show<WH7896> these my signs<WH226> in their midst,<WH7130>

and that you may tell<WH5608> in the hearing<WH241> of your son,<WH1121> and of your son<WH1121>'s son,<WH1121> what things I have done<WH5953> to Egypt,<WH4714> and my signs<WH226> which I have done<WH7760> among them;<WH3045> that you may know that I am Yahweh.<WH3068>"

Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175> went in<WH935> to Pharaoh,<WH6547> and said<WH559> to him,<WH3068> "This is what Yahweh, the God<WH430> of the Hebrews,<WH5680> says:<WH559> <WH4970> 'How long will you refuse<WH3985> to humble<WH6031> yourself before<WH6440> me?<WH5971> Let my people go,<WH7971> that they may serve me.<WH5647>
Or else,<WH3588> if you refuse<WH3986> to let my people<WH5971> go,<WH7971> behold,<WH4279> tomorrow I will bring<WH935> locusts<WH697> into your country,<WH1366>

and they shall cover<WH3680> the surface<WH5869> of the earth,<WH776> so that one won't<WH3201> be able to see<WH7200> the earth.<WH776> They shall eat<WH398> the residue<WH3499> of that which has escaped,<WH6413> which remains<WH7604> to you from the hail,<WH1259> and shall eat<WH398> every tree<WH6086> which grows<WH6779> for you out of the field.<WH7704>

Your houses<WH1004> shall be filled,<WH1004> and the houses of all your servants,<WH5650> and the houses<WH1004> of all the Egyptians;<WH4714> as neither your fathers<WH1> nor your fathers<WH1>' fathers<WH1> have seen,<WH7200> since the day<WH3117> that they were on the earth<WH127> to this day.<WH3117>'" He turned,<WH6437> and went out<WH3318> from Pharaoh.<WH6547>

Pharaoh<WH6547>'s servants<WH5650> said<WH559> to him,<WH4170> "How long will this man be a snare to us?<WH582> Let the men go,<WH7971> that they may serve<WH5647> Yahweh,<WH3068> their God.<WH430> Don't<WH2962> you yet know<WH3045> that Egypt<WH4714> is destroyed?<WH6>"

Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175> were brought again<WH7725> to Pharaoh,<WH6547> and he said<WH559> to them,<WH3212> "Go, serve<WH5647> Yahweh<WH3068> your God;<WH430> but who are those who will go?<WH1980>"

Moses<WH4872> said,<WH559> "We will go<WH3212> with our young<WH5288> and with our old;<WH2205> with our sons<WH1121> and with our daughters,<WH1323> with our flocks<WH6629> and with our herds<WH1241> will we go;<WH3212> for we must hold a feast<WH2282> to Yahweh.<WH3068>"
He said<WH559> to them,<WH3068> "Yahweh be with you if I will let you go<WH7971> with your little ones!<WH2945> See,<WH7200> evil<WH7451> is clearly before your faces.<WH6440>
Not so!<WH3212> Go now you who are men,<WH1397> and serve<WH5647> Yahweh;<WH3068> for that is what you desire!<WH1245>" They were driven out<WH1644> from Pharaoh<WH6547>'s presence.<WH6440>

Yahweh<WH3068> said<WH559> to Moses,<WH4872> "Stretch out<WH5186> your hand<WH3027> over the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> for the locusts,<WH697> that they may come up<WH5927> on the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> and eat<WH398> every herb<WH6212> of the land,<WH776> even all that the hail<WH1259> has left.<WH7604>"

Moses<WH4872> stretched out<WH5186> his rod<WH4294> over the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> and Yahweh<WH3068> brought<WH5090> an east<WH6921> wind<WH7307> on the land<WH776> all that day,<WH3117> and all the night;<WH3915> and when it was morning,<WH1242> the east<WH6921> wind<WH7307> brought<WH5375> the locusts.<WH697>

The locusts<WH697> went up<WH5927> over all the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> and rested<WH5117> in all the borders<WH1366> of Egypt.<WH4714> They were very<WH3966> grievous.<WH3515> Before<WH6440> them there were no such<WH3651> locusts<WH697> as they,<WH310> neither after them shall be such.

For they covered<WH3680> the surface<WH5869> of the whole earth,<WH776> so that the land<WH776> was darkened,<WH2821> and they ate<WH398> every herb<WH6212> of the land,<WH776> and all the fruit<WH6529> of the trees<WH6086> which the hail<WH1259> had left.<WH3498> There remained<WH3498> nothing<WH3418> green,<WH6086> either tree or herb<WH6212> of the field,<WH7704> through all the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>
Then Pharaoh<WH6547> called<WH7121> for Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175> in haste,<WH4116> and he said,<WH559> "I have sinned<WH2398> against Yahweh<WH3068> your God,<WH430> and against you.
Now therefore please forgive<WH5375> my sin<WH2403> again,<WH6471> and pray<WH6279> to Yahweh<WH3068> your God,<WH430> that he may also take away<WH5493> from me this death.<WH4194>"
He went out<WH3318> from Pharaoh,<WH6547> and prayed<WH6279> to Yahweh.<WH3068>

Yahweh<WH3068> turned<WH2015> an exceeding<WH3966> strong<WH2389> west<WH3220> wind,<WH7307> which took up<WH5375> the locusts,<WH697> and drove<WH8628> them into the Red<WH5488> Sea.<WH3220> There remained<WH7604> not one<WH259> locust<WH697> in all the borders<WH1366> of Egypt.<WH4714>
But Yahweh<WH3068> hardened<WH2388> Pharaoh<WH6547>'s heart,<WH3820> and he didn't<WH1121> let the children of Israel<WH3478> go.<WH7971>

Yahweh<WH3068> said<WH559> to Moses,<WH4872> "Stretch out<WH5186> your hand<WH3027> toward the sky,<WH8064> that there may be darkness<WH2822> over the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> even darkness<WH2822> which may be felt.<WH4959>"
Moses<WH4872> stretched out<WH5186> his hand<WH3027> toward the sky,<WH8064> and there was a thick<WH653> darkness<WH2822> in all the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> three<WH7969> days.<WH3117>

They didn't<WH7200> see one<WH376> another,<WH251> neither did anyone<WH376> rise<WH6965> from his place for three<WH7969> days;<WH3117> but all the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> had light<WH216> in their dwellings.<WH4186>

Pharaoh<WH6547> called<WH7121> to Moses,<WH4872> and said,<WH559> "Go,<WH3212> serve<WH5647> Yahweh.<WH3068> Only let your flocks<WH6629> and your herds<WH1241> stay<WH3322> behind.<WH2945> Let your little ones also go with you.<WH3212>"
Moses<WH4872> said,<WH559> "You must also give<WH5414> into our hand<WH3027> sacrifices<WH6213> and burnt offerings,<WH5930> that we may sacrifice<WH6213> to Yahweh<WH3068> our God.<WH430>

Our livestock<WH4735> also shall go<WH3212> with us.<WH6541> Not a hoof shall be left behind,<WH7604> for of it we must take<WH3947> to serve<WH5647> Yahweh<WH3068> our God;<WH430> and we don't<WH3045> know with what we must serve<WH5647> Yahweh,<WH3068> until we come there.<WH935>"
But Yahweh<WH3068> hardened<WH2388> Pharaoh<WH6547>'s heart,<WH3820> and he wouldn't<WH14> let them go.<WH7971>

Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559> to him,<WH3212> "Get away from me!<WH8104> Be careful to see<WH7200> my face<WH6440> no more;<WH3254> for in the day<WH3117> you see<WH7200> my face<WH6440> you shall die!<WH4191>"
Moses<WH4872> said,<WH559> "You have spoken<WH1696> well.<WH3651> I will see<WH7200> your face<WH6440> again no more.<WH3254>"
